trans-unit.source: Introduction
trans-unit.target: Introduction

trans-unit.source: Most everyone who uses a computer has heard the terms, kilobyte (kB), Megabyte (MB), Gigabyte (GB) and even Terabyte (TB), usually when referring to the size of computer files and hard drives as well as download speeds.
trans-unit.target: Most everyone who uses a computer has heard the terms, kilobyte (kB), Megabyte (MB), Gigabyte (GB) and even Terabyte (TB), usually when referring to the size of computer files and hard drives as well as download speeds.

trans-unit.source: Bandwidth or connection rates are measured in bits/second.
trans-unit.target: Bandwidth or connection rates are measured in bits/second.

trans-unit.source: But what is a bit and what is a byte and what do they have to do with computers?
trans-unit.target: But what is a bit and what is a byte and what do they have to do with computers?

trans-unit.source: Picture a basic room light.
trans-unit.target: Picture a basic room light.

trans-unit.source: The light is either on or it is off.
trans-unit.target: The light is either on or it is off.

trans-unit.source: You control the current state of the light by flipping a switch that has only two settings, down (light off) and up (light on).
trans-unit.target: You control the current state of the light by flipping a switch that has only two settings, down (light off) and up (light on).

trans-unit.source: The earliest computers used a series of mechanical switches to control the flow of electricity through their circuits, turning each one on or off.
trans-unit.target: The earliest computers used a series of mechanical switches to control the flow of electricity through their circuits, turning each one on or off.

trans-unit.source: The on/off states of the circuits was used to represent and even store information.
trans-unit.target: The on/off states of the circuits was used to represent and even store information.

trans-unit.source: The smallest unit of information, representing the state of one switch, is known as a bit.
trans-unit.target: The smallest unit of information, representing the state of one switch, is known as a bit.

trans-unit.source: A bit is a binary digit and has only two possible values, zero or one.
trans-unit.target: A bit is バイナリーディジット and has only two possible values, zero or one.

trans-unit.source: The value of the bit represents the current state of a single switch.
trans-unit.target: の値 the bit represents the current state of a single switch.

trans-unit.source: If the switch is off, then the bit has the value zero.
trans-unit.target: If the switch is off, then the bit has 値 zero.

trans-unit.source: If the switch is on, then the bit has the value one.
trans-unit.target: If the switch is on, then the bit has 値 one.

trans-unit.source: A bit can only represent two different values, zero or one. To represent larger pieces of information, bits are strung together in sequences of 8 called bytes.
trans-unit.target: A bit can only represent two different values, zero or one. To represent larger pieces of information, bits are strung together in sequences of 8 called bytes.

trans-unit.source: A byte is a sequence of binary digits made up of 8 bits.
trans-unit.target: A byte is a sequence of バイナリーディジット made up of 8 bits.

trans-unit.source: A byte can represent any value from 00000000 through 11111111, for a total of 256 different possible values.
trans-unit.target: A byte can represent any value from 00000000 through 11111111, for a total of 256 different possible values.

trans-unit.source: Each digit in a byte can be thought of as representing an individual switch that is either off (zero) or on (one).
trans-unit.target: Each digit in a byte can be thought of as representing an individual switch that is either off (zero) or on (one).

trans-unit.source: Modern computers rely on transistors, which pack millions of tiny switches into a chip smaller than your thumb, but information is still represented in essentially the same way: as a series of ones and zeros.
trans-unit.target: Modern computers rely on transistors, which pack millions of tiny switches into a chip smaller than your thumb, but information is still represented in essentially the same way: as a series of ones and zeros.

trans-unit.source: By using binary, computers can represent information simply and efficiently using a system that is very effectively modeled in digital circuitry.
trans-unit.target: By using binary, computers can represent information simply and efficiently using a system that is very effectively modeled in digital circuitry.

trans-unit.source: Review
trans-unit.target: Review

trans-unit.source: A Bit is a binary digit with two possible values, zero or one
trans-unit.target: A Bit is バイナリーディジット with two possible values, zero or one

trans-unit.source: A Byte is a sequence of 8 bits and has 256 possible values from 00000000 through 11111111
trans-unit.target: A Byte is a sequence of 8 bits and has 256 possible values from 00000000 through 11111111

trans-unit.source: A kilobyte (kB) is 1,024 bytes or 2^10 bytes
trans-unit.target: A kilobyte (kB) is 1,024 bytes or 2^10 bytes

trans-unit.source: A Megabyte (MB) is 1,048, 576 bytes or 2^20 bytes
trans-unit.target: A Megabyte (MB) is 1,048, 576 bytes or 2^20 bytes

trans-unit.source: A Gigabyte (GB) is 1,073,741,824 bytes or 2^30 bytes
trans-unit.target: A Gigabyte (GB) is 1,073,741,824 bytes or 2^30 bytes

trans-unit.source: A Terabyte (TB) is 1,099,511,627,776 bytes or 2^40 bytes
trans-unit.target: A Terabyte (TB) is 1,099,511,627,776 bytes or 2^40 bytes

trans-unit.source: Notes
trans-unit.target: 追加情報：

trans-unit.source: The ones and zeros of bits and bytes can be used to represent letters, numbers, and even different keys on a computer keyboard.
trans-unit.target: The ones and zeros of bits and bytes can be used to represent letters, numbers, and even different keys on a computer keyboard.

trans-unit.source: A bit can be used to hold a Boolean (true/false) value. A value of zero represents ‘false’ and a value of one represents ‘true’.
trans-unit.target: A bit can be used to hold ブール値 (true/false) value. 値 of zero represents 「偽（false）」 and 値 of one represents 「真（true）」.
